metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24504 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Uncontrolled resource consumption in some Intel(R) Ethernet E810 Adapter drivers for Linux before version 1.0.4 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via local access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> these are intel out-of-tree drivers. according to suse bug, the in-tree drivers are fixed via b126bd6bcd6710aa984104e979a5c930f44561b4 possibly introduced in 334cb0626de1 ("ice: Implement VSI replay framework")

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
